item.title: Overflowing bins, 24th July
item.description:
The 4 bins in this parklet have been overflowing for months. There’s rubbish everywhere and when I walk by in the evening there’s foxes and rats picking apart the bags. Please can these be cleaned up and/or the owner of these bins instructed to resolve thi

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Theydon Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light fixed, thanks, but now ON continually!, 24th July
item.description:
L reported that this light was off, and it was fixed the next day. Thank you. But the light has been ON ever since it was replaced. We waited a day to see if it would go off but it has shone non-stop and is still shining as l write. Must be using up your electricity.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Hugh Street, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manure being throw onto the footpath, 24th July
item.description:
A large pile of manure is developing now. The manure is being thrown from the field the other side of the fence line onto the footpath. Rather than getting ride of their own manure, this is being thrown onto the public byway. This is now starting to create a nuisance and will soon create an obstruction across the footpath. What3words catch.trap.comb And Curl.figure.stop This has been building over the last few weeks/months

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parsonage Lane, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen Pillar, 24th July
item.description:
Hi I am one of the volunteers at The old English garden , we had a pillar fall down in a storm in December , we contacted Tom Neeves and wonder if anyone we can contact who can let us know if we can break up the pillar or get our own quotes to get this done , the pillar has been laying down and grass is dying under it , we also wondered if we could make a feature of this ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Park, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Van, 24th July
item.description:
Van that has been abandoned and dumped outside resident properties. An eye sore and dangerous for people, particularly children who live in the area. Promoting squatters and animals.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The electrical bin by Elephant and Castle roundabout needs to be emptied - it is getting more and more things piled on top (this photo is a few days old) and people are starting to dump rubbish against it, 24th July
item.description:
Please can the vin be emptied because people are placing electrical items next to or on top of it and people are now adding other waste. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Kent Road, Elephant and Castle, London

item.title: Bins not emptied-one is taped up but full and rubbish all over plant area attracting rats, 24th July
item.description:
Unfortunately these bins are not suitable for purpose. They are very small and some people pile up rubbish around them. They were recently taped up but the rubbish around them in the flower beds is hardly ever cleaned up— recently on two occasions I saw a rat in the flower beds. This means that the rubbish is attracting vermin. There have been other local problems with rats and I think this could be contributing. It would be better to remove the bins or place them in a more suitable location, or at least ensure they are of a suitable size.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Kent Road, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping and burning of waste, 24th July
item.description:
There are constantly vans bringing in waste which is burned in a barrel right beside my building or dumped in the car park, the smoke and rubbish are becoming a health hazard for everyone around the area, this has been going on for months now and nothing has been done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Compton Place, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
